mainEntity.name: Where on Earth is Ziro? Why is it so famous?

acceptedAnswer.text: Ziro Valley lies in Lower Subansiri, Arunachal Pradesh. It's famous for scenic views, the Apatani tribe, and the annual Ziro Festival of Music featuring indie rock.

mainEntity.name: How far is Guwahati to Ziro?

acceptedAnswer.text: Around 448 km and takes about 12 hours by road.

mainEntity.name: How is the road condition from Naharlagun to Ziro?

acceptedAnswer.text: It's a mix of two-lane and four-lane highways with occasional landslides. Generally, in good shape.

mainEntity.name: Any Permit required to enter Arunachal Pradesh?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes. ILP (for Indian nationals) or PAP (for foreigners) is required.

mainEntity.name: How far is your campsite from the festival ground?

mainEntity.name: How safe is it for female solo travelers or in groups?

acceptedAnswer.text: Very safe. Northeast India is known for gender respect and hospitality.
